question.title: Unable to view Camel Quarkus Metrics in Docker Container
question.body:
I have a Camel Quarkus application and I want to view the Camel Quarkus metrics. When I run the application in Quarkus dev mode, the metrics are visible (/metrics endpoint) and everything works as expected. See image below.

However, when I containerize the application using Docker and try to access the metrics endpoint, the metrics are not available. See image below.

pom.xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>quarkus-micrometer</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    
    <!-- Camel Micrometer integration (collects route metrics (like exchanges, processing times) -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.camel.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>camel-quarkus-micrometer</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    
    <!-- Camel Core -->
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.camel.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>camel-quarkus-core</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    
    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>quarkus-micrometer-registry-prometheus</artifactId>
    </dependency>

application.properties

quarkus.smallrye-health.root-path=/health
quarkus.log.level=INFO

# Enable Micrometer core
quarkus.micrometer.enabled=true
quarkus.micrometer.export.defaults.enabled=true

# Enable /q/metrics endpoint (Prometheus format)
quarkus.micrometer.export.prometheus.enabled=true
quarkus.micrometer.export.prometheus.path=/metrics

Docker does not seem to read the application.properties file, so I have created a .env file and pass the values in application.properties file to Docker.

.env

# Logging
QUARKUS_LOG_LEVEL=INFO

# Micrometer Metrics
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_ENABLED=true
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_DEFAULTS_ENABLED=true

QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_ENABLED=true
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_PATH=/metrics

My Docker command

docker run --rm --env-file .env --name my-container -p 8080:8080 com.mycompany/my-container

answers.body:
Environment files are not automatically parsed by docker run --env-file the way a .env file would be parsed by docker-compose.

The .env files are automatically interpreted by docker-compose, but not by docker run.

docker run --env-file

Requires explicitly specifying the path to the .env file, but still only passes the variables to the container. It does not interpret the format or handle quirks like quotes, comments, or spaces the same way as Compose

It seems like some of your comments/text in the .env file are not correctly interpreted by docker run.

I would suggest two options:

  1. Delete all comments from the .env file

    QUARKUS_LOG_LEVEL=INFO
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_ENABLED=true
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_DEFAULTS_ENABLED=true
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_ENABLED=true
QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_PATH=/metrics

  2. Pass the env variables in the docker run style, aka one by one using the -e flag (at least try it in order to debug):

    docker run --rm \
  -e QUARKUS_MICROMETER_ENABLED=true \
  -e QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_ENABLED=true \
  -e QUARKUS_MICROMETER_EXPORT_PROMETHEUS_PATH=/metrics \
  -p 8080:8080 com.mycompany/my-container

Issue resolved.

I have been using an old version of my code to build the Docker image.

I did the build with Docker.

docker build --build-arg tag=1.0.4 -t test-app .

79667362.body: both paths are not working unfortunately. Thanks for trying.
@Haxed Hi Haxed, sorry to hear that. Does the path localhost:8080/q/metrics work? Second test, can you docker exec -it my-container curl localhost:8080/metrics ?

Thanks @aran for answering my question. I have used the -e flag and /metrics does not work. From my testing, the .env file text works for all other things e.g. Dynatrace monitoring, setting the Log level, etc. Only /metrics is not showing up. :-(
